greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Proth numbers: of the form k*2^m + 1 for k odd, m >= 1 and 2^m > k.
comment: A Proth number is a square iff it is of the form (2^(m-1)+-1)*2^(m+1)+1 = 4^m+-2^(m+1)+1 = (2^m+-1)^2 for m > 1. See A086341. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Apr 22 2019
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Amelia Carolina Sparavigna, Discussion of the groupoid of Proth numbers (OEIS A080075), Politecnico di Torino, Italy (2019).
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Proth Number
formula: a(n) = A116882(n+1)+1. - _Klaus Brockhaus_, _Georgi Guninski_ and _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2010
mathematica: Select[Range[3, 1500, 2], And[OddQ[#[[1]] ], #[[-1]] >= 1, 2^#[[-1]] > #[[1]] ] &@ Append[QuotientRemainder[#1, 2^#2], #2] & @@ {#, IntegerExponent[#, 2]} &[# - 1] &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 04 2019 *)
program: (PARI) isproth(x)={ (x>1) && !bittest(x--,0) && (x>>valuation(x,2))^2 < x } \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Aug 16 2010; edited by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 23 2019
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jan 24 2003
